item.text: After they traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

<st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="1525" class="">went</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> the Jews in the synagogue,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2596">as</st> he <st data-num="1486" class="">customarily</st> did, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">on</st> <st data-num="5140" class="">three</st> <st data-num="4521">Sabbath days</st> he <st data-num="1256" class="">addressed</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="1124" class="">scriptures</st>,

<st data-num="1272" class="">explaining</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3908" class="">demonstrating</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="5547" class="">Christ</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1163" class="">had to</st> <st data-num="3958" class="">suffer</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> to <st data-num="450" class="">rise</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="3498" class="">dead</st>,<n id="3" /> saying,<n id="4" /> “<st data-num="3778">This</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="2605" class="">proclaiming</st> to <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> the <st data-num="5547" class="">Christ</st>.”<n id="5" />

<st data-num="5100" class="">Some</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">of</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> were <st data-num="3982" class="">persuaded</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532">and</st> <st data-num="4345" class="">joined</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="2532">and</st> <st data-num="4609" class="">Silas</st>, along with a <st data-num="4183" class="">large</st> <st data-num="4128" class="">group</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="4576" class="">God-fearing</st> <st data-num="1672" class="">Greeks</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="5037" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">quite</st> a <st data-num="3641" class="">few</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="4413" class="">prominent</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">women</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> became <st data-num="2206" class="">jealous</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4355">gathering together</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> <st data-num="4190" class="">worthless</st> <st data-num="435" class="">men</st> from the rabble in the <st data-num="60" class="">marketplace</st>,<n id="2" /> they <st data-num="3792">formed a mob</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="2350" class="">set</st> the <st data-num="4172" class="">city</st> <st data-num="2350" class="">in an uproar</st>.<n id="4" /> They <st data-num="2186" class="">attacked</st> <st data-num="2394">Jason’s</st> <st data-num="3614" class="">house</st>,<n id="5" /> <st data-num="2212">trying to find</st> <st data-num="846">Paul and Silas</st><n id="6" /> to <st data-num="4254" class="">bring</st> them <st data-num="4254" class="">out</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="1218" class="">assembly</st>.<n id="7" />

When they did <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2147" class="">find</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, they <st data-num="4951" class="">dragged</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2394" class="">Jason</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="80" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="4173">city officials</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="994" class="">screaming</st>, “<st data-num="3778">These people</st> who have <st data-num="387">stirred up trouble</st><n id="3" /> throughout the <st data-num="3625" class="">world</st><n id="4" /> have <st data-num="3918" class="">come</st> <st data-num="1759" class="">here</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">too</st>,

and<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2394" class="">Jason</st> has <st data-num="5264" class="">welcomed</st> <st data-num="3739">them</st> <st data-num="5264">as guests</st>! <st data-num="3778">They</st><n id="2" /> are <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> <st data-num="4238" class="">acting</st> <st data-num="561" class="">against</st> <st data-num="2541">Caesar’s</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="1378" class="">decrees</st>, <st data-num="3004" class="">saying</st> there <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="2087" class="">another</st> <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> named<n id="4" /> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st>!”<n id="5" />

They caused <st data-num="5015" class="">confusion</st> among<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="3793" class="">crowd</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4173">city officials</st><n id="2" /> who <st data-num="191" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="3778">these things</st>.
After the city officials had received bail from Jason and the others, they released them.
The brothers sent Paul and Silas off to Berea at once, during the night. When they arrived, they went to the Jewish synagogue.

<st data-num="3778" class="">These Jews</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1510">were</st> <st data-num="2104" class="">more open-minded</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2104" class="">than</st> those <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="2332" class="">Thessalonica</st>,<n id="3" /> for <st data-num="3748" class="">they</st> <st data-num="3956 4288">eagerly</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="1209" class="">received</st><n id="5" /> the <st data-num="3056" class="">message</st>, <st data-num="350" class="">examining</st><n id="6" /> the <st data-num="1124" class="">scriptures</st> <st data-num="350" class="">carefully</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">every</st> <st data-num="2250" class="">day</st><n id="7" /> to see <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">these things</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">were</st> <st data-num="3779" class="">so</st>.

<st data-num="3767" class="">Therefore</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">many</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">of</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="4100" class="">believed</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">along</st> with <st data-num="3756" class="">quite</st> a <st data-num="3641" class="">few</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2158" class="">prominent</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1674" class="">Greek</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">women</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="435" class="">men</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="5613">when</st> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2332" class="">Thessalonica</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1097" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> had <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="2605" class="">proclaimed</st> the <st data-num="3056" class="">word</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="960" class="">Berea</st>, they <st data-num="2064" class="">came</st> <st data-num="2546" class="">there too</st>, <st data-num="4531" class="">inciting</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5015" class="">disturbing</st><n id="4" /> the <st data-num="3793" class="">crowds</st>.

<st data-num="5119" class="">Then</st> the <st data-num="80" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="1821" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="1821" class="">away</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="2281" class="">coast</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2112">at once</st>, <st data-num="5037" class="">but</st> <st data-num="4609" class="">Silas</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5095" class="">Timothy</st> <st data-num="5278" class="">remained</st> <st data-num="1563">in Berea</st>.<n id="2" />
Those who accompanied Paul escorted him as far as Athens, and after receiving an order for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they left.
While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was greatly upset because he saw the city was full of idols.

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> he was <st data-num="1256" class="">addressing</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4576" class="">God-fearing Gentiles</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="4864" class="">synagogue</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="58" class="">marketplace</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="3956">every</st> <st data-num="2250" class="">day</st><n id="5" /> those who <st data-num="3909">happened to be there</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">Also</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="1946" class="">Epicurean</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4770" class="">Stoic</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="5386" class="">philosophers</st> were <st data-num="4820" class="">conversing<n id="3" /> with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> were <st data-num="3004" class="">asking</st>,<n id="4" /> “<st data-num="5101">What</st> does <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="4691">foolish babbler</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="2309" class="">want</st> to <st data-num="3004" class="">say</st>?” Others said, “He <st data-num="1380" class="">seems</st> to <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> a <st data-num="2604" class="">proclaimer</st> of <st data-num="3581" class="">foreign</st> <st data-num="1140" class="">gods</st>.”<n id="6" /> (They said this <st data-num="3754" class="">because</st> he was <st data-num="2097">proclaiming the good news</st> about <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="386">resurrection</st>.)<n id="7" />

<st data-num="5037">So</st> they <st data-num="1949" class="">took</st> <st data-num="846" class="">Paul</st> and<n id="1" /> <st data-num="71" class="">brought</st> him to the <st data-num="697" class="">Areopagus</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="1410">May</st> we <st data-num="1097" class="">know</st> <st data-num="5101" class="">what</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="2537" class="">new</st> <st data-num="1322" class="">teaching</st> is that <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="2980" class="">proclaiming</st>?

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> you are <st data-num="1533" class="">bringing</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> <st data-num="3579">surprising things</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">our</st> <st data-num="189" class="">ears</st>, <st data-num="3767" class="">so</st> we <st data-num="1014" class="">want</st> to <st data-num="1097" class="">know</st> <st data-num="5101">what</st> <st data-num="3778">they</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1510">mean</st>.”
(All the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there used to spend their time in nothing else than telling or listening to something new.)
So Paul stood before the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I see that you are very religious in all respects.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> as I <st data-num="1330">went around</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="333">observed closely</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="4574" class="">objects of worship</st>,<n id="1" /> I <st data-num="2532" class="">even</st> <st data-num="2147" class="">found</st> an <st data-num="1041" class="">altar</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">with</st> <st data-num="3739">this</st> <st data-num="1924" class="">inscription:</st><n id="2" /> ‘To an <st data-num="57" class="">unknown</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">god</st>.’ <st data-num="3767" class="">Therefore</st> <st data-num="3739">what</st> you <st data-num="2151" class="">worship</st> <st data-num="50">without knowing</st> it,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="2605" class="">proclaim</st> to <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>.

The <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> who <st data-num="4160" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="2889" class="">world</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">everything</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3778">who</st> <st data-num="5225" class="">is</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st> of <st data-num="3772" class="">heaven</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1093" class="">earth</st>, does <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2730" class="">live</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="3485" class="">temples</st> <st data-num="5499">made by human hands</st>,<n id="3" />

<st data-num="3761" class="">nor</st> is he <st data-num="2323" class="">served</st> <st data-num="5259" class="">by</st> <st data-num="442" class="">human</st> <st data-num="5495" class="">hands</st>, as if he <st data-num="4326" class="">needed</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">anything</st>,<n id="1" /> because he <st data-num="846">himself</st> <st data-num="1325" class="">gives</st> <st data-num="2222" class="">life</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4157" class="">breath</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">everything</st> to <st data-num="3956" class="">everyone</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="1537" class="">From</st> <st data-num="1520" class="">one man</st><n id="1" /> he <st data-num="4160" class="">made</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">every</st> <st data-num="1484" class="">nation</st> of the <st data-num="444" class="">human race</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="2730" class="">inhabit</st> the <st data-num="3956" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="1093" class="">earth</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="3724" class="">determining</st> their <st data-num="4367">set</st> <st data-num="2540" class="">times</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="3734">fixed limits</st> of the places where <st data-num="846" class="">they</st> would <st data-num="2733" class="">live</st>,<n id="5" />

so that they would <st data-num="2212" class="">search</st> for <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> and <st data-num="1487 686">perhaps</st> <st data-num="5584" class="">grope around</st><n id="1" /> for <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2147" class="">find</st> him,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532 1065">though</st> he <st data-num="5225" class="">is</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3112" class="">far</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="1538" class="">each</st> <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="1473" class="">us</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> we <st data-num="2198" class="">live</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2795">move about</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">exist</st>, <st data-num="5613" class="">as</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">even</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> of your <st data-num="4771" class="">own</st> <st data-num="4163" class="">poets</st> have <st data-num="3004">said</st>, <st data-num="1063" class="">‘For</st> we <st data-num="2532" class="">too</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> his <st data-num="1085" class="">offspring.’</st><n id="2" />

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> since we <st data-num="5225" class="">are</st> <st data-num="2316">God’s</st> <st data-num="1085" class="">offspring</st>, we <st data-num="3784" class="">should</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3543" class="">think</st> the <st data-num="2304" class="">deity</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3664" class="">like</st> <st data-num="5557" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="696" class="">silver</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="3037" class="">stone</st>, an <st data-num="5480" class="">image</st><n id="2" /> made by <st data-num="444" class="">human</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="5078" class="">skill</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1761" class="">imagination</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="3767" class="">Therefore</st>, although <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="5237" class="">overlooked</st><n id="1" /> such <st data-num="5550" class="">times</st> of <st data-num="52" class="">ignorance</st>,<n id="2" /> he <st data-num="3568" class="">now</st> <st data-num="518" class="">commands</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> <st data-num="444" class="">people</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="3837" class="">everywhere</st> to <st data-num="3340" class="">repent</st>,<n id="4" />
because he has set a day on which he is going to judge the world in righteousness, by a man whom he designated, having provided proof to everyone by raising him from the dead.”
Now when they heard about the resurrection from the dead, some began to scoff, but others said, “We will hear you again about this.”
<st data-num="3779" class="">So</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="1831" class="">left</st> the <st data-num="3319 846">Areopagus</st>.<n id="1" />
But some people joined him and believed. Among them were Dionysius, who was a member of the Areopagus, a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
